comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Trying to remember what was built there . . . ?

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] It was the site of the first Government House. "After Government House was demolished, the site was used variously as a carter's yard, a fruit shop, a confectioner and a tobacco shop, government offices, accommodation for nurses during the Second World War and a car park. At one stage it was to become the site of the city's town hall and later was mooted as the location for a multi-storey office block." www.environment.gov.au/heritage/places/national/first-gov... Now the site of the Historic Houses Trust's Museum of Sydney www.hht.net.au/museums/mos

comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] Thanks, I meant immediately after 1899.  I don't recall a photo of this corner pre or post that date.  One will turn up when least expected  . . .

comment._content: Nice to see that, apart from the Metropole, all readily visible buildings in shot still stand, although the trees outside the Public Instruction Office went in 1911.
